content.question: Which of the following could be a slope field for the differential equation <math> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>+</mo> <mi>y</mi> </math> ?

choices.label: Each option shows a slope field. The horizontal axis is labeled x, the vertical axis is labeled y, and the origin is labeled O. The numbers negative 2 and 2 appear on the horizontal axis. The numbers negative 2 and 2 appear on the vertical axis.   (A) There are 15 rows and columns of segments. From left to right, the slopes of each row of segments gradually increases. The top row of segments begins with a horizontal segment then the segments gradually increase slope. The middle 13 rows of segments gradually increase slope from negative slopes to a horizontal segment to positive slopes. The horizontal segments occur on the line y equals negative x. The bottom row of segments begins with a steep negative slope then gradually increases slope to a horizontal segment.

Each option shows a slope field. The horizontal axis is labeled x, the vertical axis is labeled y, and the origin is labeled O. The numbers negative 2 and 2 appear on the horizontal axis. The numbers negative 2 and 2 appear on the vertical axis.   (B) There are 15 rows and columns of segments. From left to right, the slopes of the segments gradually decrease from steep positive slopes to a horizontal segment to steep negative slopes. The horizontal segments occur on the y axis.

Each option shows a slope field. The horizontal axis is labeled x, the vertical axis is labeled y, and the origin is labeled O. The numbers negative 2 and 2 appear on the horizontal axis. The numbers negative 2 and 2 appear on the vertical axis.   (C) There are 15 rows and columns of segments. From left to right, the slopes of each row of segments gradually increases. In the top two rows, the slopes of the segments are always positive and gradually increasing. In rows 3 through 13, the rows of segments gradually increase slope from negative slopes to positive slopes. As the rows approach the x axis, each row begins with a steeper negative slope and the x coordinate of the change in slope from negative to positive slopes increases toward x equals zero. In the bottom two rows, the slopes of the segments are always positive and gradually increasing. The slopes of segments in the first and fourth quadrants are always positive.

Each option shows a slope field. The horizontal axis is labeled x, the vertical axis is labeled y, and the origin is labeled O. The numbers negative 2 and 2 appear on the horizontal axis. The numbers negative 2 and 2 appear on the vertical axis.   (D) There are 15 rows and columns of segments. For the rows of segments above the x axis, the slopes of the segments are all positive. From left to right, the slopes gradually go from steep positive slopes to less positive slopes to more positive slopes. From left to right on the x axis the slopes of the segments gradually go from steep positive slopes to a horizontal segment to steep positive slopes. For the rows of segments below the x axis, from left to right the slopes of the segments go from positive to horizontal to negative to horizontal to positive. The horizontal segments occur in the third and fourth quadrants. From top to bottom, the slopes on the y axis decrease from steep positive to steep negative slopes.
